boat.name: Masquerade
boat.full_description: Masquerade's first owner fitted out an empty GRP moulding, 1997-1999, and rigged her as gaff cutter with alloy mast, boom and gaff. She has a Douglas fir bowsprit with external track for re-circulating the ball gaff traveller saddle and an external track for topsail luff.
boat.short_description: 'Masquerade' is a GRP gaff cutter built in 1999.

for_sales.sales_text:
Rugged go-anywhere shallow draft East Coast cruising boat, "Masquerade" is a Bruce Roberts `Spray 28â€™ gaff cutter built on a GRP hull from Humber Boat Builders Ltd., 1997. Large galley & nav area. Three full length berths in two cabins. Hull underwater epoxied from new. Fitted out by current owner and launched during 1999 from Suffolk Yacht Harbour, Levington, Suffolk.

LOD 9.4m, Beam 3.20m, Draft 1.00m LOA 11.30m Displ. 6.5 tons

Hollow Douglas Fir bowsprit. Alloy mast, boom and gaff by Sailspar, re-circulating ball gaff saddle, external track for the topsail, and roller furling on the jib, all designed for easy single-handing.

Jib #1 & #2, reefing staysail, main & topsail by Gayle Heard, Ford XLD 1.6, PRM gearbox, Halyard shaft seal, 3-blade prop. Stainless diesel and water tanks. Navico log/depth, Garmin 128, ICOM vhf/DSC, Entel 640 h/h, Navico TP32, Balmar charge regulator, twin 110Ah batteries.

Faversham stove, SMEV hob/oven, double sink, Jabsco + hand basin in heads compartment

Part 1 registration due for renewal November 2016. Sale to include all fittings, equipment, spares, GRP tender, and heavy-duty winter cover. Matching Jacobs cradle may be available by separate negotiation.

In commission, lying afloat at Maldon, Essex. Viewing by arrangement.
